etymology.description: 𣦼 (cán, "phonetic component") is a variant form of 𣦻 (cán, "phonetic component").
etymology.interpretation: This character 𣦼 (cán, "phonetic component") is historically used as an alternative representation of 𣦻 (cán, "phonetic component"), likely sharing its phonetic value.

examples.chinese: 这个汉字包含𣦼(𣦼)，表明其发音规律(表明其發音規律)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè gè hànzì bāohán cán, biǎomíng qí fāyīn guīlǜ.
examples.english: This Chinese character includes 𣦼 as a phonetic component, indicating its pronunciation pattern.

examples.chinese: 学者研究了𣦼(𣦼)，揭示了汉字构造之谜(揭示了漢字構造之謎)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yánjiū le cán, jiēshì le hànzì gòuzào zhī mí.
examples.english: Scholars studied 𣦼 and uncovered the mystery of Chinese character composition.
